page.title: 12EDWINSTOWE FIRE STATION
page.content: The{volunteer part-time firemen of {Edwinstowe}have an emergency room which is reached by telephone or telegraph.Details are written down and then the volunteers are called in by radio operated bleepers they carry.Any firemen who can, hurry to the Station to change into their black and yellow uniforms and safety helmets. Each uniform has an individual's name in and they collect two discs with their name on so the duty officer knows who is on duty.Then it's away to answer calls usually in Edwinstowe but also to large fires in places like Retford. In hot dry summers the greatest danger is{forest and heath fires}the last serious one being in 1976 when a lot of the forest was destroyed. There is a fire-tower in the forest to check for smoke.
